member.name: F:FavoriteQueries.FavoritesDockpaneViewModel.queryMap
member.summary: This is a Map of the Name of the ArcGIS.Core.Data Table/FeatureClass backing the Layer to the List if Queries are set up for the corresponding Table/FeatureClass Since FavoriteQuery is an abstract class, SubClass the FavoriteQuery for the specific case

member.name: F:FavoriteQueries.FavoritesDockpaneViewModel._heading
member.summary: Text shown near the top of the DockPane.

member.name: M:FavoriteQueries.FavoritesDockpaneViewModel.UpdateLayers
member.summary: This method will populate the Layers (bound to the LayersComboBox) with all the Feature Layers present in the Active Map View

member.name: M:FavoriteQueries.FavoritesDockpaneViewModel.UpdateQueries(System.String)
member.summary: Based on the selected layer name, the query Map is used to populate the Queries Combobox

member.name: M:FavoriteQueries.FavoritesDockpaneViewModel.DoWork
member.summary: Based on the Query Selected, the FeatureData (bound to the DataGrid) is populated with the results of the Query

member.name: T:FavoriteQueries.FavoriteQuery
member.summary: This class represents a Favorite Query The Execute method is supposed to Execute the query desired and return a list of objects to be populated in the grid

member.name: T:FavoriteQueries.FavoritesDockpane_ShowButton
member.summary: Button implementation to show the DockPane.

member.name: T:FavoriteQueries.Module1
member.summary: This addin will list all subtypes for a Feature Class and allow deletion of all features which have the selected subtype
member.remarks: 1. In Visual Studio click the Build menu. Then select Build Solution. 2. Click Start button to open ArcGIS Pro. 3. ArcGIS Pro will open. 4. Open a map view that contains atleast one Feature Layer whose source points to a Feature Class (From either a File Geodatabase or an Enterprise Geodatabase) 5. Make sure the Map Pane and the corresponding Table of Contents (TOC) Pane are Open and the Map Pane is Active 6. Click on the Add-In Tab 7. Click the Show Favorites Dockpane Button and the DockPane opens 8. Select a layer from the Layers ComboBox 9. If there are any Queries set up for the Layer, they will show up 10. Select one of the Queries and click Go 11. The results are displayed below in the same Pane

member.name: M:FavoriteQueries.Module1.CanUnload
member.summary: Called by Framework when ArcGIS Pro is closing
member.returns: False to prevent Pro from closing, otherwise True

member.name: M:FavoriteQueries.Module1.ExecuteCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Generic implementation of ExecuteCommand to allow calls to to execute commands in your Module.

member.name: P:FavoriteQueries.Module1.Current
member.summary: Retrieve the singleton instance to this module here
